control.apply:
#!/system/bin/sh

a=$1

if [ $a -lt 4200 ]; then
  echo 4200 > /sys/module/max17048_battery/parameters/max_voltage_mv
  exit
fi

if [ $a -gt 4400 ]; then
  echo 4400 > /sys/module/max17048_battery/parameters/max_voltage_mv
  exit
fi

echo $a > /sys/module/max17048_battery/parameters/max_voltage_mv
control.title: Battery Max Designed Voltage
control.description:
This value should depend on max designed voltage of installed battery. Bad value may cause degradation, fire and explosion of the battery. So set voltage properly.
[Li-ion: 4200mV. Li-poly: 4350-4400mV].
[Nexus 5 BL-T9: 4350mV].
